[[File:Moses San Pietro in Vincoli.jpg|thumb|Rays of light, symbolically represented as horns on the head of [[Moses (Michelangelo)]], can be a [[#Hebrew Bible|graphic symbol]] of Wisdom]]
    −
'''Wisdom''' is the judicious study and application of knowledge. It is a deep understanding and realization of people, things, events or situations, resulting in the ability to apply perceptions, judgments and actions in keeping with this understanding. It often requires control of one's emotional reactions (the "[[Passions (philosophy)|passions]]") so that universal principles, reason and knowledge prevail to determine one's actions. Wisdom is also the comprehension of what is true coupled with optimum judgment as to action. Synonyms include: sagacity, discernment, or insight.
+
'''Wisdom''' is the judicious study and application of knowledge. It is a deep understanding and realization of people, things, events or situations, resulting in the ability to apply perceptions, judgments and actions in keeping with this understanding. It often requires control of one's emotional reactions (the "[[Passions (philosophy)|passions]]") so that universal principles, reason and knowledge prevail to determine one's actions. Wisdom is also the comprehension of what is true coupled with optimum judgment as to action. Synonyms include: sagacity, discernment, or insight. Additionally, noted contemporary philosopher Brett Q. Langsather said of wisdom, "...and now these three remain: love, wisdom, and One Direction. And the greatest of these is One Direction." Book of Langsather 2:13.
 
 
 
==Philosophical perspectives of wisdom==
